7QGnrwz-6VyVqG1ZLKQ3NA.text: Every time I've been here it's been lovely. Tuesday's they have 2$ tacos so there's your first win. The also have VERY friendly servers and bartenders, that alone makes me want to go there again and again.   Their peach blended margarita is so delicious. And I obviously got tacos, also awesome. They came with amazing refried beans and rice! The best. A must go.

zr4Ee4tcVNAD825tNnleFQ.text: As with most casual Mexican restaurants, very reasonably priced and good authentic food. Nice bar specials throughout the day also not just at happy hour. The yelp app provided great freebie in the form of fresh guacamole which was a nice bonus.

NlkO6IxM3l4UTkmZg5qA0A.text: I am so glad that Totopo exists in Mt Lebanon. Mexican cuisine can be hit or miss and this place is defiantly a hit. Great food for reasonable prices. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

dyphqvtbCi4yG14giovRaw.text: Great happy hour and super friendly staff! Whether my husband and I just sit at the bar or if we bring our kids we always enjoy ourselves and leave happy and full. The skinny margarita is awesome and their chips are thin, crispy and salty.

MCnaNguaIBKL1AqcB_yuNQ.text: I decided to stop here for lunch after having seen it was finally open. When I entered I learned they had been open for a week now. They have free WiFi which always comes in handy and I was seated immediately. I noticed that they do have outdoor seating but on a rainy day I prefer indoors.  They offer a Sunday brunch menu but I found the best deal was a build it yourself option. For $8.00 you get a choice of two entrees whether they are tacos, burritos, etc and a choice of two sides. Among these sides are two different choices of rice, two different choices of beans, or a side salad. If you want three entrees then it is $10.00.  I decided to order two different soft tacos-one chicken and one beef along with the side salad and black beans. Each table is given a bowl of tortilla chips and salsa which is a generous portion.  I got my meal and thoroughly enjoyed it. I found the salad just a touch spicy but I had enough drink to wash it down. I was able to chat with folks at a nearby table where they had ordered a bowl of guacamole for dipping. The lady there told me it was just alright but I didn't get to sample it.  It is True that the service is slow but I always thought that if it is prepared the way I like it then it is worth the wait. However, when my waiter brought me my check, I asked for change and later found out he shortchanged me. I drew that matter to his attention and he corrected it saying "I thought I told him to keep the change." He must have seemed confused.  I also learned that even though there are vegetarian options given on this menu, some of these items are not vegetarian. The lady next to me told me that about the beans. I enjoyed my black beans and thought they were very tasty.  I'm allowing some latitude to the fact that they just opened and probably have a lot to learn. A second visit in the future will help me determine if they make these improvements. They have a full bar with TV sets all around but it wasn't overly noisy. Totopo is located on Washington Road in the Mt Lebanon business district near the indoor parking garage. When I asked if they validate parking during the week, the host told me he wasn't sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole dip! At adjoining table
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My other side- the salad
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken taco and ground beef tacos with black beans

apeNNAJS6bCHKUtMcx8XFA.text: THE QUESO IS DA BOMB (that's what the kids these days are saying right?)  So good. Def recommend.

l5E3lkEI2S6_-JyCD4iiKA.text: This place was just ok as I wasn't too impressed with what they had to offer. I ordered take out on a week night since It was close by and I haven't tried this place. I ordered two entrees which was pick two dishes with two sides for $12. At the beginning it sounded as a good deal so for the first entree I got two northern tamales, fried beans and rice. The second entree was two tamales, rice and soup. To our disappointment, the portions were small and the food wasn't anything extraordinary. I didn't really like my tamales as the chicken was dry and the masa tasted a bit different than what I'm used to. The portion of the fried beans was a bit less than half the serving cup that it came in. The only thing that was good was the soup. In addition, they gave us free chips but what's the point when there was no salsa?   Overall my takeout experience wasn't that great but perhaps dining in is better. Would I do take out from them again? Definitely no. Would I try dining in to see if the experience is different? I will need some convincing but probably.

XkQdVTLP7bEcd7sTg2I_xg.text: Great service. Food was tasty and lots of it. Side salad is a good size and delicious! Will be going back.

QZaHsE8Q2RnpQ2rpfsOdkA.text: We had dinner here a few nights ago. We were very happy with it. I was afraid that the fact that they had clearly spent a lot of effort on the interior design might mean that the food had that canned, corporate feeling to it. That is not the case. The food was all very good. I liked that unlike the typical "Chi-chi's-esque" Mexican restaurant, the food here was not just a handful of the same 4 ingredients rearranged in different ways and given different names. The dishes were actually different from each other. The refried beans tasted homemade. Also, the plate didn't come out laden with 10,000 calories, which I liked. I didn't finish eating and look at my plate with regret over what had just transpired. For $10 you can pick two items and two sides, which is what I did. Not only does this make more sense than reading through 42 combo options, but when you pick sides you can even pick soup as a side. You're not wedded to a scoop of rice to fill the space on your plate and in your stomach. And by the way, the tortilla soup was probably the best I've ever had. It was clearly built to a recipe and not just a chicken soup with some cream and spice added. It was full of tortilla strips which made each bite have an interesting texture. In summary: when a place offers a choice between northern or southern tamales, they probably know how to cook Mexican food.

W235RzLOTYVdSFjBpeaJBg.text: Just ok.....the service is abysmal and the wait staff seem to not know anything about the menu.  Guacamole made at the table was good and fresh. Salsa was average. Hubby's burrito was average as were the chicken fajitas.  Not that the kids menu matters to most, but it was disappointing that the chicken fingers and fries were clearly the cheapest frozen kind one can purchase.  The place is sort of confusing as it was touted as being "authentic" Mexican but to me seemed very Americanized. I was hoping for something more along the lines of La Palapa in the South Side which to me is one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants in Pgh.

HB-bVQTedgeqBP62B2dwdA.text: Excellent food and service! All very fresh and authentic! Welcome here almost weekly whether it's brunch, lunch or dinner and it's always top notch! Try the chori-polo!! Yummmm

7RqLcM1GikEEjHQXFN173Q.text: For a new place, on a Saturday night a few weeks in, I thought they pretty much had it together.  Food was fantastic. We'll be back for sure.

FS23naXJJwdgs2H4aXM6Ag.text: Tried Totopo during their first week open. The food was good, but the server was overwhelmed. Prices seemed reasonable, and I look forward to trying Notre of the menu.

6J9eNVkg38IgHXx2ELieiQ.text: Best Mexican in Pittsburgh! We have been several times and have enjoyed every time.  Service is always great and food has not disappointed.  Our go-to orders are the drowned burrito and veggie quesadilla.  Only thing We have tasted that we thought left room for improvement was the black beans-kind of bland. Absolutely LOVE that they do delivery for dinner.

JMRI-ZR5Q0l8k35OAkNxEA.text: Like everyone else in Lebo, I was excited when a Mexican restaurant opened Uptown. I wasn't impressed my first visit, but after my third visit tonight, that opinion was confirmed. Our party of six had multiple mistakes with our meals, the service was slow, and our margaritas were so watered down we wondered if there was alcohol. Everyone agreed the food was mediocre. The noise level was so loud we could barely hear one another. Two members of our party said they wouldn't return. My #1 favorite Mexican restaurant in town remains La Palapa on the South Side. Even Bea's Taco Town is better.

lHQci8ihHtAPamxYRHHmMQ.text: Great drinks and food HIGHLY recommend. Couldn't have been more perfect of a visit. They make guacamole in front of you. Wish I could've given it 6/5 stars

fG5qBPW5skioyVeRdeC_Rw.text: I went the first day at lunch, dinner & about 6 times the first week with different friends. There were service issues from the start, but we figured that would happen in the beginning.  Unfortunately that hasn't improved much. I was surprised the OWNERS NEVER came to the tables to greet the guests in those first few days.  Even when we mentioned issues, no manager or owner stopped by our table.  Although the food is really good, (specialties outstanding) the rice & beans are ALWAYS COLD (even now)  & the salsa is bland.  The biggest complaint though from friends was that instead of the wait staff clearing plates when the guests are done, the bus girl cleaned all the plates into a bus cart at the tables when the guests left.  VERY unappetizing!

AGWGU4tejZ6TcrBU1PwiGA.text: Excellent service at the bar. Solid house margarita and bomb queso. The grilled burritos are very good. Definitely recommend and walking distance from the Marriott Staybridge.

UKpFla1nAcIqwqBnEjar9g.text: Outstanding meal and customer service. Best Mexican I have had in a long time! Highly recommend!

DoIr54iBcx0O2N32VvPEFg.text: Decided to try out this new Mexican Restaurant, in the old Walnut Grill location. Start you out with the chips and salsa. I had the combo (pick 2 and 2 sides for $10.00). Had the chicken taco and chicken burrito. Had the salad and the rice as the sides. The salad was great, not sure what kind of dressing, but it was great. Service was good, host was pleasant. Nice bar area. Good overall experience, reasonably priced, good food. Give it a try!

ueNQoCnWrk9yUu7VPn7APg.text: My boyfriend and I love Mexican food. We used to frequent Round Corner Cantina but that started going downhill. We found ourselves in mount Lebanon and stopped to eat at Totopo and it is delicious! I would give it a 5 if the drinks weren't so marked up and the $16 fajita wasn't 75% vegetables. Stay away from that ripoff. The chorizo queso dip is the best in the city I have had the pleasure of so far. The drowned burrito and chorizopollo are parades of flavor on the palate. I can't wait to try more. I just took my step dad with us to eat and he was impressed. Not easy considering the years we lived on the west coast in Oregon. Food trucks there 15 years ago put most overpriced restaurants here to SHAME. We miss Coffee People, authentic Mexican food, effective public transit, and businesses that actually adhere to their operating hours. Totopo fills a bit of our food scene shaped hole. The staff is friendly and the ambiance is great.  This will be our Mexican place until someone else steals my food loving heart.

W8WXlXh8cGLYvHgX0fMkGg.text: Easily one of our favorite Mexican restaurants! The food is great and the service is always wonderful as well. The lunch combos are awesome and so is the tortilla soup!

TrXX_9ExGJSRtNVgxCSj6Q.text: What I enjoyed: yummy mixed drinks, good tortilla chips, pretty decent tamales   What I did not enjoy: my refried beans did not taste like anything. My chiles rellanos did not taste like anything (this was a huge bummer because I LOVE chiles rellanos and there aren't a lot of places that serve it).   This is a "fancier" Mexican joint-- swanky decor and a large well-stocked bar. Prices are a bit higher than your standard Mexican restaurant but it's all very appropriate for the neighborhood.   I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and there are places serving much better (and much cheaper) Mexican food in the city. However, the service was good and the food wasn't terrible. I wouldn't be opposed to going back to Totopo and trying some other selections.

ividbmQKoUvLFPvS--1xZA.text: This is a real gem in a city where finding decent Mexican food is nearly impossible. The atmosphere is tasteful and unique, managing to seem both open and roomy, but still intimate, with the main dining area partitioned off from the bar and a private party room. Every dish we've had here is delicious -- the southern style tamale and all of the enchiladas are particularly good. Great margaritas, of course, though the beer selection is lacking (not much beyond Mexican lagers). Good for large parties or small, and our kids love the churros.

I started with tortilla soup and moved on to the grilled chicken burrito, which came with the most delicious side salad with a citrus vinaigrette! Just perfect!  I went for lunch @ Totopo which means tortilla chip in Spanish (I had to ask) and was really impressed. I was greeted by very friendly young lady who cheerfully said Hola :) The restaurant is comfortable, with a very authentic Mexican vibe. My waitress was very attentive and helpful. I felt the menu was very diverse and the prices are super reasonable. They delivered free tortilla chips to the table with salsa and I ordered a drowned chicken burrito - that had rice cheese, green peppers, onions, red peppers it was delicious! I will definitely be back!

5PYVsPrxiCqDf04uC0a0cw.text: Totopo is one of my new favorites restaurants in the city! I'll across a bridge to hit up Totopo!   My boyfriend and I wanted to celebrate Cinco de Mayo early - so we made our way to restaurant around 6:15pm. There was no onstreet parking available, so we parked in a nearby parking lot for $2.   Totopo was celebrating Cinco de Mayo all weekend long, so it was the busiest it's been when I've been there. We had to wait about 35 minutes - they were giving away free prizes, so it wasn't too bad. I won a Totopo glass.   Once we finally got seated - we ordered our drinks. I ordered a strawberry frozen margarita and my boyfriend ordered a original mojito. The bar was a little backed up, but once the drinks came - they were delicious.   To start we ordered the table side guacamole and the taquitos. Everything was amazing!   We both ordered the chicken quesadillas for our entrees- heads up! It's not listed on the menu, but it's chicken, cheese, and green peppers in the quesadilla. My boyfriend had to pick his out since he doesn't like them.   For dessert- he ordered the churros! He said it was delicious!   We will definitely be going back to Totopo soon!

vc99wOcRYbeDvMtAfGTtPw.text: Totopo is located in the heart of Mount Lebanon; a prime location for sure.   I stopped in with a lunch with some coworkers recently and my experience was fine--but just fine.   I really appreciated the free 4oz guacamole that I received for the first check-in, and honestly, it was delicious. There was a lot of garlic and lime and I was pleasantly surprised. I also noticed on the menu that if you order the full size guacamole, they'll make it table side.  I ordered the Totopo salad, but received the tostada salad. Honest mistake that I didn't correct because the names and ingredients overall were very similar. The flavors of the salad were great; I particularly enjoyed the cilantro dressing. However, it was a bit overdressed. Overall it was a fresh salad that I did enjoy, I just didn't finish it once I got to the soggier lettuce.   The real draw back for me was that the service was slowwwww. It was the middle of the day on a weekday, but it was the lunch rush, and things took so long that I was late to a meeting. I would recommend this place for some tacos and margaritas, just not if you're in a hurry!

dRf60_-qEs3E7uHxqu51TQ.text: The chips and salsa weren't the best, but the margarita and tacos I got were great and the quesadilla my father got was really good, too. I didn't try their guacamole, but I'll have to go back for that. The menu is small, but they do what they do well. I'll definitely go back sometime to try more.  They're also very close to a couple parking garages and have street parking out front, so it was easy to find parking. Service was friendly and good.

G0B0Zv-v-Y6QWPP5DsSvbA.text: I tried this place for the first time and will certainly recommend it to discerning eaters who really appreciate better mexican food.  I had a chicken/ chorizo burrito that was a healthy portion and grilled just right. The guacamole was probably the best I have eaten in pittsburgh thus far so I would recommend getting the chips and guac for anyone. Beer selection was so so and server wasnt that thrilled to serve us though dont let that turn you away from this really good restaurant in mt lebo.

VR3UCGGQTvcMcp7zLcxigA.text: This afternoon my wife and I made our first visit to Totopo, the Latin American restaurant on Washington St. In Mr. Lebanon.  We have recently moved from Southern California after living there for over fourty years.  We are used to the best Mexican and Peruvian food available in our country, and enjoy it regularly.  We feared that moving to the Pittsburgh area might put an end to that, but Totopo proved us wrong.  I enjoyed the chicken mole while my wife had the tacos al pastor.  Both entrees were excellent as were the sides, chips and salsas and margaritas.  Our server, Glenn, was most knowledgeable about the history of the food and was polite and attentive throughout dinner.  A real professional.  We also had several short conversations with other staff members, including the manager, and all were informative and polite.  We left feeling content that we now had an excellent place to enjoy our favorite type of cuisine.  We will return often!

_5x6ZEiMr5Xso2rPxAa2DA.text: Disclaimer: I'm from Texas, where there are Mexican food restaurants everywhere.  I tried to ignore giving this place a review because it makes me sad and miss "home".  If I could give this place 2.5 stars I would have.  My husband and I were looking for a place to go that we could both feel like we're home.  We came here for St. Patrick's Day in the evening with full intentions of sitting at the bar.  The bar was unfortunately packed, which was a good sign that maybe the food and/or drinks would be decent.  They had a St. Patrick's Day margarita special.  I think it was a house margarita for $6. The venue was a lot bigger than I thought it would be. Huge bar in the middle of the restaurant with seating behind it and in front of it.    Since we couldn't sit at the bar, we were seated at a table in the front of the restaurant, near a TV since basketball was on (gotta love March Madness!).  Our server was prompt and courteous.  We asked her recommendations, and she said the fajitas were extremely popular.  That is what we ordered.  We decided to try and split it, just in case we didn't like it.  When we asked if we could have an extra tortilla, there was going to be an up-charge of 99 cents. We ended up not getting it because the aren't made in house... Have you ever had fresh made tortillas?  LIFE CHANGER!!!   We also ordered a small queso for our complimentary chips, which was ok.  We definitely killed the whole thing. We got our house margaritas. They were nothing special - green for St. Patty's but I couldn't recommend it to someone I cared about.   Thank goodness we split the fajitas. We ordered the mix up (steak and chicken fajitas).  Both tasted teriyaki flavored or like a stir fry.  We didn't like it, and I could hardly eat one fajita.  It was disappointing. So, in all the restaurant didn't pass our fajitas test, and if I came again I would definitely have to order a margarita with a better quality tequila.  I could see this as a spot for drinks and chips - and that's about it.

sbmFsIlB4PljoQSyENlWzA.text: Haven't had Mexican in awhile.  Good selection and great service.   Was greeted right away and seated.    The atmosphere was nice.  They had live Mexican music playing.   Was there with another couple and the music made it hard for a conversation.  Al on all though a good experience.  Good portion sizes and came out hot.   The fried ice cream was fabulous

oy_gMHRMHaib-WAigPhGtQ.text: The service is always quick, the food is always good, and they usually have a couple beer/drink specials going on. We've gone many times and never left disappointed.

uEF8rl1UufeCel66bgjUXA.text: There's the average Mexican restaurants, and then a step above the rest that is...Totopo. From the atmosphere to the wait staff to the food. Speaking of food, come hungry. If you overdo it on the chips and salsa, there won't be any real estate left in your belly for all the delectable deliciousness. The Pick 2 or Pick 3 options gives you the most variety from classics like enchiladas and burritos to the rarer menu finds like tamales, with both Northern and Southern styles available. It's also one of the few places in the Pittsburgh area that offer seafood-based tacos, such as grilled shrimp or fried cod. Every meal comes with a your choice of sides, but I recommend the customary fiesta rice and beans (and this is coming from someone that doesn't really do beans of any type!). This is simply a great addition to the Lebo food scene on Washington.

SOuusax21jxXaFz0iI4Mog.text: This place is amazing!! The food never disappoints and the service is always great!   Soon as you get sat the chips and salsa are coming! The queso is to die for! From the tacos to the main dinners nothing is wrong! Love coming on Tuesday for taco Tuesday, the prices are always right! Can't wait to come back soon.

H5n1pCItB8Rf7_mbNg3VEw.text: Best Mexican in town!  Ivan and Chuy are especially great.

MPpI8KHaYJvcqPvNzxQPcQ.text: Never disappoints! Consistantly good food, excellent service. Hope they become a Lebo mainstay!

JgafA73ZhvI9PMRTd0kkoA.text: I loved everything about this place!!!! Mt. Lebanon, you never disappoint me. The vibe of the restaurant is cozy, colorful, and warm. My boyfriend and I were feeling it from the moment we walked in. The fresh chips (amazing) and salsa were brought promptly to our booth and devoured just as quickly. I took advantage of the complimentary queso dip with the Yelp check-in and boy oh boy, am I glad I did! OUTSTANDING. My boyfriend ordered the shrimp tacos and said they rival the best he's ever had. I ordered the steak fajita nachos, and not only are they gorgeous to look at, they're equally scrumptious. My boyfriend had a late barber appt across the road so I moved to the bar to enjoy a frozen peach mango margarita while he got a haircut. The margarita was great, blended perfectly, & equal parts sweet and tequila.  Do yourself a favor and go give this place a try if you haven't already .... sooooooo good!

Wocj9TSiS7bP1OwsDtlWrg.text: Table side guacamole is a must have! Their house margaritas are also delicious *and a tad strong, but who doesn't love that (: Overall our dinner was delicious, and we had all of our food and drinks in a timely manner.

aLVMnAN0UWew_iaB7ZI4kA.text: This was our second time to this awesome restaurant. We were celebrating my 40th birthday and this is the place I chose and I am so glad I did. There were 22 of us and when we got there they had us set up at a table in the back which was perfect! The service was impeccable and the food outstanding! Thank you totopo for making my birthday extra special. I will continue to send everyone I know into your restaurant. If you go get the Guacamole and the shrimp tacos are the best I've ever had!

wS2TcMxqlyGzosOnubpcCQ.text: I just moved to the area and I am a huge fan of Mexican cuisine. I've been trying to find a nice restaurant in the area with good food.  We sat at the bar. The service was super speedy and always on top of what we'd need next. I enjoyed a strawberry margarita. Not too sweet and not too strong. Just perfect! You can always judge a Mexican restaurant on their salsa and Totopo had fantastic salsa.   This place is much better than other sit-down Mexican restaurants I've found in the area. Plus it's very upscale inside and, of course, is situated in the adorable business district of Mt. Lebanon.

When we first got there the waiter was awesome and brought over 2 baskets of chips and salsa right away. I order the mahi mahi fish tacos (they are not on the menu anymore but they still make them) and they were amazing!!!! I usually don't like fish on tacos but they were so meaty and didn't taste too fishy like other fish tacos I've had in the past. The table side guacamole is definitely worth it for an appetizer, it's cool being able to watch it be made and it's so good!

4pvI1MqndHDQU69B888-gw.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Pittsburgh. Great service and yummy food. So glad it's here!

zebl81yEZrwCSN4KgJrkKg.text: I would have to say this is a great place. It's a little pricy, but worth it. Food is great and service is excellent.

cETnkbVq_IJM-JyCDVp7_g.text: We visited for taco Tuesday ($2 basic tacos, $3 menu tacos). Also for happy hour. We were happy with the food and drink specials as well as the service. Everyone was polite and attentive. I wasn't crazy about the tacos but I will definitely come back to try other menu items!

VW-QQrJJg8BmGrYoUVKOPg.text: I had my son's graduation party in their private party/conference room (back of the restaurant). I was very happy with the experience! Mya was the manager handling the event, and she was very patient throughout my many calls and questions. She let me know ahead of time that she wasn't going to be there the day of, and she was very careful to share all of the information with those who would be there. This attention to good communication was very noticed and very helpful! Everything was set up as we discussed. The server, Gabby, had been well informed. The other manager already knew about the tech needs/set-up. All of the staff seemed genuinely interested in making sure the event was a success, and I really appreciated that! The room was very nice - clean, private, and great decor. The LCD was easy to use. They quickly found things we needed to hang a few decorations. Setting up was easy, and it looked great! The food was good. We had a buffet that included salad, 2 appetizers, and fajitas. I've eaten at Totopo several times before, and we really enjoyed those previous meals! The buffet wasn't quite as excellent, but still good. I just chalked it up to the difference between an individual meal and a buffet. And the price was very reasonable for an all-you-can-eat buffet that included non-alcoholic drinks. And the guests enjoyed having Mexican food instead of the traditional graduation cook-out.  The facility and customer service really made this an amazing experience. They were genuinely friendly, and that makes such a difference! My son, family, and friends had a great time. Thanks Totopo!

nd_xTN3qfkuJ6ueZ4sQd5w.text: We often go to Totopo as it is always good food and service, reasonably priced.  They do a great job and everyone who has gone there has always had good things to say. Tableside guacamole is the best anywhere!

gR5vDrqx-dbTav_kqTP_OQ.text: Went for lunch and was served promptly by a friendly and helpful server. Great chips and salsa. Meal was excellent and tasted more authentic than other Mexican places. Will be back soon

ILSxMVuZYyDtt3D4zrA6tQ.text: Let me start by saying, "I'm not a big Mexican food fan." That said and out in the open, they have really yummy salsa, chips and GUACAMOLE! You must order the tableside prepared guac. It was really delicious! I ordered a pick 2, having an enchilada and a quesadilla. They were both very good and a nice size portion. It came with a side. I ordered the salad. Unless you are a fan of cilantro (I am NOT!!), skip the salad. The other options for dressing just didn't work for me; they were generic and bland. We didn't order drinks, but they did have a nice size bar with lots of options. The others in my party had salads and loved them! Again, cilantro is like poison to me; so I would not have ordered them. We didn't have leftovers, but were definitely full. Give it a try and let me know what you think!

QWMFFPiXPYFJHorbNo_dOQ.text: O.M.G. Totopo wins all around. They have the BEST service out of any restaurant I have been to in Pittsburgh. Chewy and Ivan are two of my favorites but I love the whole team :)   Food I'm obsessed with - fish tacos, table side guacamole, chorizo queso, chori pollo   Margaritas are great too!

N0I0pyjbcMxEGIviMFmd3Q.text: First time eating in, but have ordered many times. Can't say enough good things. The atmosphere, decor and the food was fantastic. You have to try the tableside Guac, so fresh and tasty. Chips and salsa were great also. My wife's taco salad was very good and she loved her Mojito. I got a triple combo, tamale, enchilada and chile rellano, a trifecta of tasty Mexican treats. Can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining area.

K6HDXFYKpJ2GgzPr8HWb2Q.text: Eh, I'd give this place 2.5 stars. I've been here twice and both times left underwhelmed with the food, one time recently and once just after they opened.  Pros: Free chips and salsa, good margaritas, good side salad.  The first time I got tacos al pastor and the pork was very fatty. I couldn't eat most of it. Similar issue with my second experience, ordering a chicken burrito. They don't trim their meat well at all. The chicken was gristly and sinewy and very hard and unpleasant to chew. Perhaps in their dishes where their meat isn't already cut, the food is better. But the other ingredients didn't make up for the poor cuts of meat. There are better local Mexican chains and restaurants I'd got to again before going here, for a meal at any rate, though for drinks I might stop in. Even places I've reviewed before and wasn't impressed with, as at least they aren't as pricey as Totopo.

Zh9PcrqUS2j_dqeSvLYazA.text: A new favorite! A detailed, carved wood hostess stand and warm colors welcome you. My friend and I chose a late lunch on a Saturday to try Totopo and both were completely satisfied with the choice. Quick and friendly service. Our server was a little hard to hear; a soft talker but attentive. We ordered the tableside quac to go along with the chips and very tasty salsa. The quac is definitely suited for four people but we nearly polished it off ourselves because it was creamy and fresh and prepared with just enough of each ingredient that not one of the flavors overpowered the other. My friend ordered from the combo menu (enchilada and mushroom quesadilla) and I ordered the fish tacos. Hearty portions at very reasonable prices. Washed it all down with house margaritas. In my opinion it beats Emiliano's hands down.

TxTQtwa-ARhnMAEXBfq3jA.text: Great cocktails.  Pleasant stuff.  Food not quite my thing, but I'd definitely go back for the bar.

Ia_1eeU2OGKSGli4XUCgMQ.text: I really like this restaurant and so wish they had one where I live. The food was great and the service impeccable. One thing that stood out was that each employee I saw, looked and acted like they love their jobs even at the lunchtime rush. On the way back from the loo, the bartender greeted me and asked how the experience was going. He asked what I ordered so then I asked which cerveza de barril (beer on tap) he would have with it. The one he suggested was delicious and 'paired' nicely with the meal. He even stopped by the table later to ask how I liked it. We go to Mount Lebanon regularly and will definitely eat here again.

vwzBYZeNqLETH2351gMmdw.text: This place is cute and they have great margaritas. I also love the tablesode guac. However, I feel that the food is a little Americanized. I was only here once and i enjoyed my time there. I would go back again. Mostly for the great margaritas. The place has a cute decor and ambiance. The service was also really great.

uF8G4H5368UVC-Pwf0cNfQ.text: I first ordered the fresh, tableside guacamole. It was so flavorful, fresh, and good! The only complaint that I have is that I ate it too fast to get a picture. For my entree, I ordered the Enchiladas Verdes, which were also outstanding. This is a great restaurant and totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing Enchiladas Verdes!

7bf1560x8rYgDZlMa86_2w.text: Make the drive to Mt. Lebo... I promise it's worth it.   My roommate and I had his on our must visit list for months. I continually made excuses why we shouldn't drive outside the city until finally we committed to going on a Friday night. Totally worth it!   First, it was really crowded. The line was out the door so expected a long wait, but when we checked in they told us only 30 minutes. We waited by the bar for our table and browsed the drink menu. Aside from the obvious margaritas, they have a ton of options. We didn't drink, but made a note to go back just for happy hour.   Once we were seated we were quickly greeted by our server who went over changes/updates to the menu and brought us chips and salsa.   We started with the cheese empanadas and table side guac. I've had some of the best home made empanadas so I'm a total critic. If anyone knows of any other cheese empanadas in the city, please let me know so I can try them... anyway, these ones were actually really good. I was surprised how much I liked them. I'll for sure be ordering them again on our next trip. The guac wasn't my favorite. For $12 I'd skip it. Dinner I ordered the Apollo Chorizo tacos. By this point you're too full to eat basically anything... but they were so good! I frequently seek out chicken chorizo tacos all over he city and can say these are right on top with others I've had.   If you think you've had the best Mexican in Pittsburgh, I challenge you to add this to your list.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0fxMbZQnj-9cx1MzeAxHBg.text: I love Totopo, especially on Taco Tuesday because it's such a great deal. Their food is delicious and the margaritas are huge! The free chips and salsa is an added bonus. Definitely try the tableside guacamole and tableside queso con chorizo. Both are amazing. I've never been disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Free chips and salsa plus Tecate cerveza.

yQxD336XrFF3eqZ13iY65A.text: Have been wanting to try here for a while, but they can sometimes have very long waits. We came around 6:30 on a Friday night and the wait ended up being only about 10 minutes when they said 20 minutes. They start you off with the house salsa which was nice! Also, make sure to check in on yelp and get some queso or guac! We went with the guac and it was delicious as well with the perfect amount of lime! We then started with the spinach queso dip and was unimpressed. There was so much spinach that I barely tasted any of the queso. For our main meal, I had the choripollo tacos and my friend had the drowned burrito. We had just gotten our queso, when our main meals had arrived. Would have preferred to have them more spread out. The drowned burrito was huge, definitely closer to two servings. The choripollo tacos were good! It came with two salsas that definitely added flavor. Overall, the food was good but nothing exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Choripollo tacos with drowned burrito in the back
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach queso, guac, salsa!

cczPcps8Q86bHhHArk_5UA.text: I love discovering new places I haven't heard of.  When that place just happens to serve Mexican fare, I am all in.  Totopo delivered on both aspects for me.  We showed up midday, after the lunch rush and before dinner rush was to start.  This allowed us to be seated right away and making for stellar service.  We had menus in hand and were given a few minutes to look it over.  I wanted to try just about a bit of everything, just because.  The best way to accomplish this is perhaps opting for a combo.  If you do choose the combo you have to then decide just how hungry you are.  You have your choice of a two or three entree combo.  Knowing how I always overdo it, I went with the two entree combo so I wouldn't be a lump on the world later.  With this I decided that I would give the burrito and enchilada verde a try.  The burrito is made up of a flour tortilla filled with your choice of ground beef or chicken, I went with the ground beef.  Then it is topped with a roasted tomato salsa.  The enchilada verde you have a choice of ground beef, chicken or cheese, I opted for ground beef again.  Then it is topped with cheese sauce, tomatillo sauce and sour cream.  The best thing about both is that the tortillas that are used are made in house and fresh.  You can actually see them being made if you have a good enough seat.  I watched for just about the whole length I was here and was impressed by how many they must make in a day.  Now, with a combo you get a choice of two sides.  The sides are your basic selections you would expect from a Mexican restaurant.  Black beans, fiesta rice, refried beans, soup of the day and a side salad.  I went with the refried beans and the side salad, which they call Casa Side Salad.  The Casa Side Salad is a mixed greens based salad with tomatoes, topped with a cilantro dressing and tortilla strips.  For my safety due to allergies, I removed the tortilla strips.  The salad was amazing and a great way to start the meal.    Everything tasted amazing.  I was over the moon with everything.  My stomach was doing a happy dance.  Or that could have been the Mexican Mojito I had.  I was so impressed by the service we had that I will be back here in the future and I will be filling myself with some amazing Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 2 Combos Your Way

y7gxc1nxWWHQo0_w4winiQ.text: Food flavors are pretty repetitive across many options on the menu. Service is better than average. Chips are phenomenal but, I do tent to feel that prices are a little bit higher for what is being presented on the plate. I just wish servers weren't so focused on their phones compared to filling up our glasses.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole, Queso Dip, Chips, Salsa
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Totopo Salad
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Skinny Tacos

wJXsy_rEbjSelU2whSj_6Q.text: If you're looking for some delicious Mexican food, Totopo is a great recommendation! You get free chips and a salsa when you are sat at your table. My friends and I also ordered a small queso and the table side guacamole. They make the guac right in front of you, which is different and neat to watch! For my meal, I ordered the chicken fajita quesadilla. This was loaded with chicken, peppers, and onions.  The food was delicious, the service was okay, but I will definitely be back!

7rbMwsesodM6vNj5NYgHQw.text: I don't know where to begin.   We were greeted and sat for lunch. The place they sat us was nice. Between two windows but I would have rather sat directly in front of the window instead of in the middle of two. This is really just a minor issue, it was a pretty day and the windows were open. The restaurant was not busy at tables only at the bar.  We ordered the table side guacamole. The man asked us if we wanted it extra picoso and we said yes. After he made the guacamole and we tasted, it was definitely missing 2 things. Salt and lime! For as much as we paid for that I would expect it to be perfect. The molcajete was cute but let's make sure the food tastes good it's not just about presentation.   We both ordered carne asada. It was fine, there was nothing notable.  I asked the waitress if the corn tortillas were made fresh. She said everyday. I'm honestly really confused about this because the tortillas they served us were DRY even in foil after being steamed. Not pliable at all. Looked and tasted like store bought mission tortillas.  My husband had a couple beers and ordered a tamarindo margarita. It was too sweet. I couldn't have any because I'm pregnant but I'll take his word for it. He said it didn't taste like alcohol just pure sugar.   We finished off dinner with a pastel de tres leches. This was actually the star of the meal. I will say though. The cake was a little bit too gritty. I've made many pastel de tres leches and you really have to get the right ratio of eggs in this recipe to make sure it's night and fluffy and not too heavy. This one was very heavy and gritty, but it was still pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OgnbWs4nT0xhoh1PujDrMA.text: I LOVE Totopo! The food is always fresh and delicious. The staff are pleasant and the restaurant is immaculately clean. It's a great environment for couples, families, and friends and the prices are nice.

7JRt8C-pZ1QGuCSrj6YFxQ.text: I am the girl who hates everything, and the food here was excellent.  Crazy good margaritas, and the mar y tierra was outstanding.  Huge grilled shimp w steak medallions in a creamy red sauce.  It was excellent and w week later I'm still thinking about it.

Vmcz3Ea1vhwDG5r28xGkww.text: Amazing service and great food for a reasonable price. There's a ton to choose from on the menu. I would HIGHLY suggest the frozen mango margarita and corn soup.  A few other things I had were the Chile relleno, quesadilla with chicken, and enchilada Verde. All were amazing. They also offer complementary chips and salsa. Chips needed salt and salsa was bland (however they have a multitude of hot sauces which I used to kick it up). I will DEFINITELY be back!

Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco combo with rice
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Combo

whllwNLTHFvuEVJ9xlDEOw.text: This place has recently gotten a lot of buzz. It's location is great and as I walk past it is always buzzing with noise. One day I decided to try and and sadly I was disappointed. Do not get me wrong it's is ok Mexican food, good ride refried beans and great chips and salsa, but sadly I just do not understand why people are crazy for totopo. It wasn't a waste of money but I'll probably just not go back. No hard feelings.

X9vU1yoghzfE4z_CqcXE5Q.text: Really disappointed in service tonight. It took almost 20-30 minutes just to get drinks. We saw others who were seated after us eating and drinking but we were left just sitting forever. Our server also had a big table in another room that she seemed more concerned with. We almost got up and left. Once we got drinks the margaritas were watered down. Our server was not apologetic or concerned that we waited for such a long time.

-M8to8QXRqUJ9IfOalMKAw.text: I was in the Mt. Lebanon area on a Wednesday night with my family looking for a restaurant, and Totopo popped up on Yelp with a plethora of positive reviews, so we decided to give it a shot. In the end, we were all pleased and looking forward to trying it again in the future.  We were greeted cheerfully by staff and grabbed seats in their side room, away from their surprisingly crowded main dining room and bar. Shortly thereafter, our server dropped off complementary fresh chips and delicious, moderately spicy salsa. Throughout our night there, service was efficient, present, and very friendly from the entire staff.  I ordered a smothered steak burrito. It had steak, large helpings of peppers and onions, rice, and was utterly covered in salsa and cheese. As large as the burrito was, I wasn't weighed down afterwards since it had a higher proportion of meat and vegetables to rice.  My family were all rather pleased with their dishes. My mother raved about her salad, my dad enjoyed his healthy serving of enchiladas, and my wife spoke well of her chicken burrito, but stated that the quesadilla was good, but nothing spectacular.  Eating at Totopo was such a pleasant experience that I would go out of my way to come back their with friends and family to eat. Give it a shot when you're in the mood for Mexican food.

yPchVxpnhIHwzpKPM-SKBg.text: We have gone back here many times. The guac they make at your table is awesome as well as the pitchers if margs. Everything is fresh and authentic

xHyD90zikWZr107z8xeU3w.text: Totopo is a festive addition to Mt Lebanon! We made a reservation via Yelp to take grandma for a birthday celebration. Our server was very sweet, but seemed a bit rushed all night.   We started with the table-side guacamole, which was fresh and delicious! We enjoyed having them make it at our table, and the fresh taste.  We each ordered different items for dinner, and were all pleased with our choices. The food was all fresh and flavorful, but I'd try something other than the enchiladas rojo next time - they were a bit heavy for me.   FYI- We thought we ordered the Yelp check-in offer guacamole, but they brought us the table side guacamole. When we went to pay she told us she brought us the table side guacamole instead of the 4oz one, and we had to pay for it... bummer but figured I would share so someone else doesn't run into that problem.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Topo Changa

j1LrJxLOhky4HqT1clIEhA.text: So very meh. I'm used to Los Angeles caliber Mexican food and this was the furthest cry from that you can imagine. Everything tasted bland, canned, and jarred. Mexican food with no spice? Bar service was friendly, but our waitress was so grumpy once we sat down. I couldn't finish/didn't want to finish my food, which is a rarity.

BdVxIVEK4pR0ChNi7uR2xQ.text: Not your average Mexican Restaurant. Lovely decor and bar.  There are many tables and a separate room for possibly groups.  Meals are served on heavy plates and no paper napkins here.  Cloth is a step above. Really outstanding menu with well prepared dishes.    Friendly service by Morgan who was so efficient, I will be asking for her on my next visit.  And, yes I plan on coming here often.  Before our chip bowl was empty, but with smaller chips, Morgan appeared with a loaded bowl of fresh chips.  There are many options on the menu I want to try.  I like the veggie options and the lettuce wrap tacos.  The jicama chips are freshly cut sticks of jicama with a savory dusting of a spice.  The build your own is a good concept.The guacamole is made table side if you want the large portion  A YELP check-in will score you a choice of a small guac, or queso.    They do a Happy Hour from 4 to 6pm.  A discount of $1 on beers, half price house margaritas and half off appetizers, except the guacamole.  Parking along the street can be a challenge but a small public lot is not far away on a side street.

EwQ5sDmpX7rJnH6vY5Wjlg.text: Oh lovely Totopo!! If only other restaurants could learn from the service your staff gives. It's always so prompt & attentive.  Also, the food the both times we have been is fantastic.  The fish tacos are possibly the best in Pittsburgh.  Also, the wife loves the choriopolla asado bowl. LIKE LOVES IT!!! Keep up the good work.  Any one looking for Mexican, this is highly recommend.

R9UoFQAtwk6OxqCv0c4Pcg.text: After reading the reviews, I had my hopes up that this new restaurant would be great, however, I was disappointed. I got the al pastor tacos, which had hardly any pork on them but we're full of raw onions. My husband got the cilantro lime chicken tacos. They were much fuller than my pork ones, but the chicken was so incredibly dry that they were not good at all. The rice served with the tacos had no flavor.  I will say, we did have good service sitting at the bar. The house margaritas and chips & salsa were both very good. Next time, I think we will just go for drinks & eat elsewhere.

41Q-vNKd1oBfVxN5XRzWMA.text: Cool atmosphere. The food wasn't bad, just not very fresh or hot when it came to the table. The white Queso tasted a little like plastic and got hard the minute it started to cool down. It was the same cheese in my enchiladas so they were hard when they got to the table. Also my waitress was very sweet but couldn't understand a lot of what we were saying and sometimes needed to get another waitress to help translate. For example we didn't want sour cream, but the waitress brought out extra sour cream and charged us a dollar for it.

t4W1uRrDuK_xV13hjn0DPg.text: Excellent food had the burrito pork it was delicious and service the guacamole was outstanding!!

1IHTn02euPdLGr4UhVvmtQ.text: I came here for the first time moving to Mt. Lebo and was highly impressed. The table side guacamole was huge and well worth the price. My boyfriend and I ordered the combination plates because we couldn't decide on what to order. The food came out fairly fast and hot.

hfnzDdb1By4sbdedkhQpuw.text: Oh I want to go here! I hope they are wheelchair accessible! I go with my friend in my regular chair- The way they treat me is a sign that food is good & I heard good things now & they improved food and better options! Hopefully will go soon love Mexican food! I haven't had authenticMexican food in years! Their used to be a place at Zelenople airport called El Toros they were authentic anyone know if their still there?

PKmjXzWwb40RwYXT8DVGlg.text: The chimichanga I received was dried out.  It was like eating a piece of leather.  Maybe it should be served with a sauce on top like other places.  After my dining companion complained about the steak for their fajita, I tried a piece and guess what?  The steak was dried out too.  I came here after reading all the good reviews and I really wanted to like it, but it just wasn't meant to be.  Maybe I caught them on an Off Night and maybe I'll give it another try down the road, but I'm not in a hurry to do so.

SonkX77Zf_AL_mRNb1GE5w.text: Delicious food/drinks and amazing/friendly service! Highly recommend to anyone in the local area

dMdW153jbDSBgC69xcu5QA.text: One of the few places I can justify having taco Tuesday at. Very large pescatarian friendly menu. Haven't tried anything other than the seafood dishes but what I've experienced, it is excellent.

NWo8ZlECdrp_ofuSF8cumA.text: Sitting here in this random suburb of Pittsburgh, PA. and got to the hotel at 9:40pm and there happened to be only 4 places open past 10pm.  We decided to hit up Totopo and we were Not disappointed!   The location is fantastic and beautiful inside, though parking kinda sucks and they do not have a private lot.   However let me say this....    THE BEST GUACAMOLE DIP I HAVE HAD SINCE PIPI'S IN PUERTO VALLARTA, MEXICO! Made to order at your table, fresh, ripe and absolutely wonderful.   A lot of mexican/ spanish restaurants are hit or miss on certain items, but everything was on point here. Even at 10:20pm at night! Everything from there spanish rice which has a great flavor, to their refried beans which were very fresh.   There signature Chimichanga with chicken are fantastic. Filled with a ton of flavored shredded chicken, topped with queso and signature sauce drizzled on top.   prices are on point as well.

Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

6plndcbp4Wels5Qx8HKQCA.text: This is a cumulative review. We love this place. Tonight was the fourth time I have been here for dinner. I don't know why I didn't review this place earlier. First, as soon as you sit down, chips and salsa arrive. We always get the table side guacamole to start. We ask for extra cilantro and extra lime juice. It is the best! We've tried the tacos, tamales, burritos, chimichangas, and more. We've never had a bad meal. Margaritas are also great-I like them with the Corralejo tequila.  My only tiny complaint is the refried beans are sometimes only luke warm.

eQOB_7kcwVyNoIuORKH00g.text: This is our favorite spot for Mexican. Food is consistently delicious, drinks are good and strong and service is always on point. And this is the only place that has our favorite beer on tap (Pacifico)!My husband raves about their choripollo and I'm a huge fan of their salads and shrimp tacos. Love the cozy Mexican atmosphere. We're here at least twice a month because it never disappoints!  PS - try the margarita sampler :)

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Margarita sampler

C8GX5KQVlxSfqLTBd279JQ.text: Solid 4 star. Good food but nothing special except the jicama chips which were awesome for a no flour eater to eat with homemade guacamole!

FtJx3gGXsqqpTnXeDeItpQ.text: Great Mexican, good atmosphere. Long wait though. This place is popular. Sadly they don't do reservations under 5 people. Get the guacamole you won't be sorry.

N-1ayKcdEqE2h8er3aCNgA.text: Best Mexican food in town! Great drinks and atmosphere.

vsaXdUiLxUbkwBcf3H_gQg.text: I love everything about Totopo! It's affordable, fresh, and delicious! Their drinks are refreshing and varied. Exactly what we needed in the area!

UeBJ5I5YZg81QT4h_4QIVg.text: One of the best Mexican food restaurants in pittsburgh! The staff is welcoming and their enchiladas are amazing! When you eat there you truly taste authenticity and feel warm and welcomed, I highly recommend you try their food if you haven't already!

E9xB5F5TO3bii7Qnc0kCDw.text: Loved the healthy option of skinny tacos on the menu.. Accompanied by a freshly juiced margarita on the rocks...  Very nice night can't wait to return! Ps- the salsa is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NE_TAZo__zMKO1ryMeOkQw.text: I was looking forward to taking my husband here since he loves Mexican food. I came here one time prior for drinks and it was fabulous. This experience was less than that.   The drinks & food were great. The service however was terrible. Our waiter (Fernando) gave us attitude for asking for more salsa chips... (we ordered the queso dip and made to order guacamole). They only give you alittle bowl with chips so I didn't understand what the issue was. We ordered margaritas and I got the Mango one and my husband got the traditional. Both good. The server asked if either of us wanted another drink and my husband said yes. 30 minutes go by and he never received his drink. The food came, which what I got was delicious (pollochorizo)- it was chicken breasts with queso and ground sausage, came with soft tortillas, pico and sour cream. Delicious.   We felt alittle better after eating our food, and instead of spending more $$$ on drinks since he never cared to bring the last ones and seemed like he was rushing us out (it was not busy there for being a Tuesday night so I didn't understand that).   Our bill came out to $73.95 without a breakdown of the items we got. My husband said it didn't look right at all as he calculated what we ordered. It was $17 more than what it should've been. We confronted the server and he said that was correct. I added the items on my phone calculator to show him and it was $17 more. He went in the back to check after I told him I wanted the breakdown. He came back and said it was $17 more he "accidentally" added extra items.  I was beyond furious. You would think he would've offered some sort of discount or took an appetizer off of the bill since that took an extra 20 minutes to prove we were correct.   Food was good, but there are PLENTY of places in pgh I'd rather go to. I can't believe the service we received. I should've complained to the Manager but I honestly did not want to stay there any longer.   Beware of items getting added on your bill. Seems like they may be doing that to more customers....  Will not be returning.

aK9j6KUGEX3CRMhCrSF0lg.text: Went with a group of friends tonight for a wonderful evening of food and fun. Disclaimer- not usually a big fan of Mexican food and don't go out of my way to eat it. Let me say loud and clear, I will be back NEXT WEEK and every week after!  Unbelievable food, great value. Get the tableside guacamole (and I usually don't like guacamole) and be prepared for the freshest, most authentic cuisine! Another STRONG recommendation - make a reservation for dinner on the weekends. We had one and were seated right away. I heard the wait without one was over 1 1/2 hours!

MPGGYF6DRWqbS2DJy-mMig.text: You guac my world:  It's funny to think about all the places we've been so far. I like to look back at past reviews. But, I also like to try new places with you.   I was especially nervous about this date. This restaurant had a lot of reviews and was close by after some shopping. I was so hungry I almost fainted in the mall bathroom....  On the fly, we chose this restaurant. I was worried I'd eat alone since there's been some stupid hiatus with supper. Anyways, we were seated within ten minutes after free parking in a side street garage. (Machine was broken)   I utilized a yelp redeemable where we could choose between cheese or guac. Nervously, i chose cheese dip. Should've went guac, because we ended up getting guac anyway.   I ordered pork tacos with pineapple salsa. This was great, just was missing one thing. I asked for sour cream but just can't pin point what it was missing. Don't get me wrong, they tasted fine...just need something.   The salsa, cheese and chips I could eat all day ...on a deserted island..it's what I would choose.   I loved my frozen mango marg.   I also loved the lady who came out and represented the homemade guac while mixing it up right in front of us. Back to original thought, should've not gotten cheese and ordered guac.   Overall, I was happy. The street this place is on also intrigued me for possible future dates.

Ti7LDp81L11JFALGvwyDbg.text: Ok, this place is wearing on me now. To start, the service is always extremely friendly. The restaurant is fun, and full of great decor and fantastic music. There is also a small outdoor seating area for nice days (no dogs allowed)   The menu selection is great and they have plenty of vegetarian options (no vegan alternatives)  Yelp provides a free dip upon check in, and there is also always a coupon in the local clipper magazine. Usually a free lunch with purchase, and last night I used a free dipper coupon ($8) which included queso, quac, and pico.   Drink specials for happy hour 4-6  Daily specials   On street metered parking, there is also a parking garage close by.

Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dip Sampler ($8) coupon in clipper magazine for free dip sampler

cD9JxjBv3MsXjo1pIcxnqg.text: Probably the best Mexican I've had in Pittsburgh. It's pretty good.   Highly recommend the Chile Renello - one of my favorite dishes.  Staff and service were extremely friendly and attentive. We also had steak fajitas - steak was cooked perfect, and the table side guacamole (which for my taste needed garlic, and lime, but guacamole is very per person)

PBphhSARHFUWr5Ib19ufPA.text: So...I am not sure I really get the RAVE reviews, but my meal was good.  I sat at the bar with a book.  The decor is typical Mexican restaurant - bright and loud - nothing special and nothing bad.   The bar service was good.      For my meal, I enjoyed the chips and salsa to start.  And I asked for a small side of guacamole.  I know they have it as an appetizer, but I was just one person and didn't want the whole hoopla of tableside preparation.   The side was very small - not much more than a tablespoon or two - and it was sort of watery.   The combo though, was good.  I got the chili relleno and the southern tamale.  Both had good flavor and were really filling.  The salad dressing was very good, though the greens were a little wilted.     All in all - a solid pick.

OJK2FKt6hMVJhwyoEIAhZQ.text: Really great Mexican food in a more upscale feel environment.  The tamales were out of this world!  I don't make it to the South Hills that often but when I come back to the area I'll be stopping through again.

bo8CjjV1nqff_FyjHDF4rQ.text: Oh my goodness! This is the most amazing restaurant I ever been to !!!! Usually Mexican restaurants I don't go to because they don't really taste good but this one I had to visit again! The waitress was amazing, she took very good care of us and made sure we were good the food was just outstanding. So much flavor and so much love in each plate. Honestly I go to PA once a year for a conference and I cannot wait for next year so I can come back

SFNd56kI-k5rtW2u8nPMZA.text: Parking: We don't generally eat in the Mt. Lebanon area so I wouldn't be able to say anything otherwise. We had an easy time parking!  Service: Great! Seated quickly. The waiter was very attentive and checked in with us.  Food: Delicious! Got the table side guacamole!  Cost: A bit on the pricier side but still had an enjoyable time.

R0iVmTy2GKOLeTY6wWFUMQ.text: Next time I will get something different for my entree, was very disappointed in the burrito's make up but everything else was very good.   We stopped here after a shopping trip the area. This is in the area of a variety of shops and food places in this area which is up on the south hills of the city. This is in line with other places but the reviews gave us the idea.   Chips and salsa on the table - and we opted to get the guacamole - which is CUSTOM MADE AT THE TABLE AND IS A HUGE MORTAR AND PESTLE presentation. Was really impressed.   Plus it was incredibly good  However- I got the big burrito, and the insides was just regular rice and crisp vegetables. When I think burritos I think orange rice and Spanish rice and fajita type vegetables.   Just wasn't Mexican to me. Burrito was more like what a family makes at home on their "Mexican night"   I'll get something else next time.   Guacamole carried this though,

xUB9EbG8s-hJZyJguaIB-Q.text: The first time I ate from Totopo it was takeout and just okay. I'm glad I gave it another chance, because you shouldn't really judge a place on their takeout unless they specialize in it or are known for that like Chinese food is.   The food was super tasty this time around and glad we made the choice to dine in. I ordered a burrito bowl with chorizo and I'd have to say the chorizo really made the dish. It had a slight kick and was delicious!   I also loved the table side gauc, it had a really great lime taste and was obviously super fresh. I would definitely order this every time I stop in. I also thought the chips were great and fresh out of the fryer. Hot and crispy, with a slight kick to the salsa too. Although I do prefer a chunkier salsa, theirs is a bit on the runny side.  The windows opening up to Washington Road on a beautiful day are just  the cherry on top of a really nice place to hit up when you're craving Mexican. Plus, service was quick and very friendly. Happy to come back soon, I need that gauc again!

_jGfL42w5-eIjpI3XXgd4w.text: We have been here for my wife and daughters birthday. It's a hidden gem in Mt. Lebanon.  The food and service is always great. They have a large bar and lot of dining room. I recommend making reservations here due to the crowds. It gets busy here

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rlbcZSkoQBpLUgD9ferPAw.text: Really enjoyed Totopo. It was Taco Tuesday & we had plenty of reasonable food options. The worst thing about Totopo is its location. I almost never do business in the town & won't mention its name. Now-- the food. My southern tamale was fabulous, reminding me of homemade tamales. The Chili Relleno was also excellent & I will order it if I go back. Even the flan was pretty damn good. The recommendation was spot on, & if it wasn't for the town it was in I'd go back often. (Food 5 stars, location 1 star, other variables like cleanliness & choice 5 stars)

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A pick three combo: Southern Tamale, Chicken Burrito, Chile Relleno w rice and refried beans.
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Trying Totopo for the first time! Highly recommended to us.

RyxFDhC-iSC1JWmNJQHACg.text: Greatxmexican food and flavors Tableside guac is awesome! So is their whole menu.    Friendly staff too Great guac and atmosphere

S-9hrUpvWE_k9WVpN_6nKQ.text: First - - - check in so you can score a free guac or queso! It's a decent size and I mean it's free!   Ivan was our server and he was quite possibly the best server we have had in a long time. So polite, fast, efficient and patient. He made our experience a million times better and I would honestly come back just for him to take care of us again.   Their menu offers a bunch of vegetarian options, but does not mention any vegan options -NO FEAR, they have so much to offer! Just ask :)   You can get plain white rice instead of their fiesta rice (which is made with chicken stock) and their cilantro rice has a small amount of dairy.   The refried beans and black beans both have the option to be vegan, double win! Just be sure to mention no cheese on them for the vegan option.   I chose to get the veggie fajitas which are sauteed in vegetable oil, no butter! The fajitas came with zucchini, squash, onions, bell peppers and mushrooms. They were perfectly prepared, not over cooked and mushy.   Ivan was beyond helpful making sure everything came out perfect. The food was soooo delicious and better than other fajitas I've had in the area. I left full, happy and even with a box of left overs!   My husband chose to go with the Taco Tuesday options. He really enjoyed the chicken chorizo and beef tacos.   We look forward to coming back and enjoying yet another perfect meal....

v92H0SDI0jWrIv4vXodlAQ.text: My first time here was yesterday evening and I'm sad to say it was my first time because I should have gone here sooner. The guacamole being prepared in front of you is what most women would line up to snap for their Instagram story. After that you will want to refrain from posting pictures of yourself because you will be stuffed from both pre dinner chips, guacamole, and salsa and your meal.  I ordered the fajita quesadilla because I could not decide between one or the other so I decided to "have my cake and eat it too." Also ordered a mango margarita which was sweeter than what I expected but was a pretty good size.  I've failed you in not having a picture of my meal but hope a pic of a marg and my word is enough to get you here.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iFj_WzBM8EgNRHACMN0mSg.text: I'm from Houston, TX where Mexican food is a staple and I give this place my stamp of approval. The table side guacamole is the best I've had in Pittsburgh. The salad dressing is a cilantro based dressing that I loved and is a great change from Mexican restaurants just throwing salsa on top as the dressing. I've also had the fajitas and they did not disappoint. Highly recommended and even better if you can snag a parking space out front!

ete7uVYSpTx1vNykd__jQA.text: Love Totopo! Delicious food and friendly service in a new and clean restaurant. Street parking or lots within 1-2 blocks. Gets very busy so reservations are recommended, however, I'm not sure they do them for small parties. We had a res for 6 and it was perfect.   Food comes out quickly and is always fresh. The table side guacamole is delicious and just a little spicy although you can tell them if you want it more or less spicy. Free salsa and tortillas for the table which is fairly common but some places don't do it! I loved the shrimp enchiladas and quesadillas are good too. I was not a fan of the veggie skinny tacos (lettuce wraps), just because they were bland. My husband has said the other tacos he has had were good. I like this much better than chain Mexican restaurants and I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp enchiladas, cilantro rice, black beans

tt99-9AQYGK6ZMBVWzDNlQ.text: Sat at the bar, service was excellent even being so busy on Taco Tuesday! Food was excellent and authentic. I had barbacoa, shrimp, and an al pastor taco. They have homemade salsas for both chips as well as in your tacos. Thought all 3 salsas were delicious. I can say with confidence this is a nice upscale taco spot, considering I am a bit of a taco snob from Chicago.

aoXHBb3QyTbHIyzMkyVKhQ.text: I love when a restaurant will accomodate dietary preferences: I am on the keto/low carb diet....you are able to choose any taco and they will prepare it on butter lettuce wraps (not specified on menu, so ask!) AND allowed for side substitutions. I had lettuce wrap tacos and grilled fajita veggies as my side at no extra cost. The tacos were fabulous. I'll be back..so nice to finally have Mexican food that is keto friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lettuce wrap tacos!!

rpcPrUlEUaiyCgY4UsrJLw.text: I really wanted to like this place, but I didn't. I felt like it wasn't very clean and there were several flies which are a turn off.  Although my husband loved his meal and the chips and salsa were good I just couldn't get passed the flies everywhere.

U3Pe05cfmqtNziSgX52odg.text: Totopo gets a 4 out of 5 from me for food, service and atmosphere. Their food is good. Not the best I've ever had, but still good! I've tried the burritos, enchiladas and tacos here. My favorite is the enchilada verde.   The restaurant is in a big space with lots of seating but it can still get crowded. You can only make reservations for 6 or more via the phone.   I've always had good service here.   If you check in on Yelp you can get a free guac or queso!!

QWhm-7_-bnZkWgLtvRHf5g.text: Totopo is one of our favorite restaurants in the city! We have never had a bad experience and always bring out of town guests here for dinner. The queso is my favorite anywhere. At least one person in our party gets the Topochanga every trip. My favorite day to go is Wednesdays for the discount Vino Margaritas, amazing! Try the shrimp enchiladas, you will not be disappointed. But make sure you try the refried beans, there is nothing like them anywhere!

SKwY4yPbr1uhlAgPkMnI7w.text: This place is good and I like it.  I might rate them 3.5 starts if I could.  But at the end of the day, it's a good take on fairly standard Mexican-American food.  No, they don't have the generic menu (no "Speedy with Rice" on this menu), and their food is fresh and well prepared.  And the service is good.  That said, I want to love this place, but I cannot find anything special enough to bump them up to four stars.  It's pretty standard, and it is well executed.  Give them a try and post a review.

bV7n0ySJupCSX17a38SGtg.text: I honestly cannot say one bad thing about this place!  Love their tamales, guac and their half price wine nights!  The staff is so friendly and we love going back for their great service.  I'm not a margarita drinker, but everyone raves about both frozen and on the rocks. Friends of ours loves the peach frozen margarita!

NWv20swiRSRBZfE9-TgAGw.text: Favorite Mexican restaurant in Mount Lebanon. Great food. Great drinks. Great atmosphere.

LCrjERhtnOt-Y5NLT5YcUw.text: Great place for table side guacamole and tacos as well as drinks. They can definitely be a bit busy so plan ahead.

nzxmB5O6O5Sn6mS88zDSzg.text: Best Mexican in the south hills. Food was awesome and the frozen margaritas were big and delicious!  Love this place.

0F-zB1qOTvlhby4mBjkt1w.text: Totopo officially shot to the top of our favorite restaurants lists! We usually come for lunch because at night they are so busy, because they are so good! I love the pick 2 or 3 option so you can try a variety of things. The cilantro salad dressing is delicious, I'd buy it bottled if I could! They have great drink specials and a brunch! The homemade churros for dessert with ice cream and fried ice cream are always a good idea, so save room. Every time we leave we cannot wait to come back. We haven't had a bad meal or service!

1kbr3UzsRxR6yNDI0qkFeQ.text: Great food! Great atmosphere! We took two kids (8 & 3) with us and it was not awkward. Chuy our waiter was very attentive and made us feel welcome. I had the tacos and my husband had the steak fajitas. Both fantastic. We also got the chips and guacamole as well as the Chorizo Queso. The queso was made right at our table, very fun to watch. It's one of our new fav spots.

yOhMmC1LuWuhBzuPGssSOw.text: Amazing establishment. Great service. Food was outstanding. Went on a Monday for lunch and cannot wait to go back for dinner.

oac1r5_tUhjmW0ge06qLNQ.text: First time, good was wonderful, atmosphere was nice and lovely, but not too loud.  Try the tamales and the avocado cream dressing.  It was new to me and really tasty.

NrH3teQyjPbZ_dNvPyY_xw.text: I've been looking for a new favorite Mexican restaurant since Gran Agave closed in the Waterfront. I've tried several places and they were mediocre until I found Totopo on Yelp! It was packed, but worth the wait. The food was very delicious and flavorful. The service was just as great. It didn't take long for the food to be served either even with a huge party they were hosting in the side room.   The only complaint I have, it's not really even a complaint, but the frozen mango margarita wasn't strong. I like to taste my tequila and I couldn't. Haha. It was still tasty though.    I will definitely be back and will recommend to others! Thank you Totopo.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Even tried dessert. Churros were amazing. Great recommendation from our server Juan. Next time, I&#39;ll try the fried ice cream.

gQP7vfOCDe-7qXjoXqgPmw.text: There once a week! Wish the food was more authentic though. The margaritas make up for it!!

tIDoCaDljbnNiSLXxY5jLA.text: Great place in Mt. Lebanon. Have been wanting to come here and try it for awhile. Their house margarita tasted awesome. I got the chile relleno and chimichanga combo. Very tasty! My mom got the carne asada. Cooked perfectly med rare. And very tasty. Giving it a 4 only because of service. But definitely would come back!!

QFKWFg-1gnwMzU53vVuqiQ.text: So my Girlfriend and I went to Totopo on Cinco de Mayo, real original I know. We were totally accepting of the fact that we would probably be walking into a shit show, however, from start to finish we had an incredible experience. Before we could even get settled at the bar, Jesus greeted us with a warm smile, took our drink order and even helped us pick the perfect tequila to sip on. He was back with our libations before we could even crack open the menu. Once we got our bearing's he arrived once more with complimentary chips and salsa and took our order. We started with the taquitos which were fantastic. I recommend requesting a lime wedge with them, as they benefit greatly from a little acidity. For my entree I did the pick 3 combo for 14$, which is a great way to sample multiple items. I chose a roja cheese enchilada, verde chicken enchilada and chili relleno. Everything was just superb, one offense I find with some Mexican restaurants is under seasoning their meat, but that is certainly not the case at Totopo. My GF had tortilla soup and Choripollo Asado, which is an amazing blend of shredded chicken and chorizo served with fresh made tortillas. She was in Heaven. Even though the place was packed with anxious, and somewhat obnoxious patrons, the staff kept their composure and from what I could tell, turned out fabulous consistent customer service. We will most certainly be back, and hopefully Jesus will be behind the Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chori Pollo Asado, with fresh made tortillas, absolutely amazing!!!
Photo of Totopo Mexican Kitchen and Bar - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken verde enchilada, cheese roja enchilada and Chili relleno, all 3 were stunners.

We checked in using yelp and got a free quac which was awesome. I ordered the nachos w taco meat as my dinner and LOVED it. It was so flavorful. It happened to be happy hour and to my surprise it was half off! I would definitely come back here again. I have some pics although they don't do the food justice.
